cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across Cuba, forecast to turn northwest over the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana or upper Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys, Florida Bay, Andros Island and portions of the central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northern Dominican Republic coast, entire Haiti coast, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, and much of Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, eastern & central Cuba, Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas, eventually U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at St. Croix as Laura has moved far west of the Virgin Islands
weather_observation.rainfall: Only isolated showers or residual swells; no heavy rainfall associated with Laura expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Lingering rough surf and rip currents possible through the next 12â€“24 h
